an3.142:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the three fine thoroughbred horses, and the three fine thoroughbred people.
an3.142:4.2: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an3.142:5.1: “What are the three fine thoroughbred horses?
an3.142:5.3: is quick, beautiful, and well proportioned.
an3.142:5.4: These are the three fine thoroughbred horses.
an3.142:6.1: “What are the three fine thoroughbred people?
an3.142:6.3: is quick, beautiful, and well proportioned.
an3.142:7.1: And how is a fine thoroughbred person …
an3.142:7.3: It’s when mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.
an3.142:7.4: This is how they’re quick, I say.
an3.142:7.5: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.
an3.142:7.6: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.
an3.142:7.7: They receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an3.142:7.8: This is how they’re well proportioned, I say.
an3.142:7.9: This is how a fine thoroughbred person is quick, beautiful, and well proportioned.
an3.142:7.10: These are the three fine thoroughbred people.”
